title: Di-electric barrier discharge cold atmospheric plasma device protocol
title_html: Di-electric barrier discharge cold atmospheric plasma device protocol

protocol.title: Di-electric barrier discharge cold atmospheric plasma device protocol
protocol.title_html: Di-electric barrier discharge cold atmospheric plasma device protocol

source.description: Place the sample plate in a sterile polypropylene case.
Place a sterile 10mm Perspex layer on top of the polypropylene case.
Place the negative ground electrode (i.e. the bottom electrode) underneath the polypropylene case.
Place the positive electrode (i.e. the top electrode) on top of the Perspex layer.
Measure the distance between the two electrodes. It should be equal to the height of the container and the Perspex layer.
Apply the plasma treatment to the sample for the required time.
After the desired treatment time is completed, turn off the voltage.
Store the sealed samples at room temperature for 24 hours.
Analyse Optical Emission Spectroscopies at 200 and 850nm using the Low Straylight Smart CCD Exemplar LS spectrophotometer and OriginPro8.
Remove the sample from the DBD-CAP device, keeping them sealed inside the polypropylene container and bag.
Follow the appropriate step case depending on the intended treatment and post treatment storage.

cases.title: Direct CAP treatment
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f3s4q","text":"To directly treat samples with CAP and analyse immediately, without post-treatment storage. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

source.description: Remove the high barrier propylene bag containing the treated samples from the DBD-CAP set-up.

source.body: It is vital for user safety to ensure this is carried out in the laminar air flow hood, as escaping reactive oxygen species are a health hazard.

source.description:
Immediately after CAP treatment, remove any remaining media in the plate and replenish with fresh culture media.
  • For 96 well plates, replenish with 100µl fresh culture media.
  • For 6 well plates, replenish with 2ml fresh culture media.
  • For 35mm petri dish, replenish with 2ml fresh culture media.
  • For 60mm petri dish , replenish with 5ml fresh culture media.
  • For 100m petri dish, replenish with 12ml fresh culture media.
Remove the Perspex layer from the sample container.
Place the sample container in the corner of the reactor, outside the plasma discharging area.
Apply the plasma treatment to the sample for the required time.
Once the desired treatment time is completed, turn off the voltage.

Immediately after CAP treatment, remove any remaining media in the plate and replenish with fresh culture media.
  • For 96 well plates, replenish with 100µl fresh culture media.
  • For 6 well plates, replenish with 2ml fresh culture media.
  • For 35mm petri dish, replenish with 2ml fresh culture media.
  • For 60mm petri dish , replenish with 5ml fresh culture media.
  • For 100mm petri dish, replenish with 12ml fresh culture media.
Set the transformer to 75kVRMS at 50 Hz.
Set the transformer to 75kVRMS at 50 Hz.
Set the transformer to 75kVRMS at 50 Hz.
Store the sealed samples in a humidified incubator under 5% (v/v) C02 at 37°C in for 24-48 hours post-treatment storage time.
Apply the plasma to the to the voltage for the required time.
Once the desired treatment time is completed, turn off the voltage.
Remove the sample container containing the samples.

source.body: It is vital for user safety to ensure this is carried out in the laminar air flow hood, as escaping reactive oxygen species are a health hazard.

source.description: Remove the samples from the container.

source.body: It is vital for user safety to ensure this is carried out in the laminar air flow hood, as reactive oxygen species are a health hazard.

source.description: Plate cells into desired plate (96 well plate, 6 well plate or petri dish (35, 60 or 100mm)) and allow to adhere overnight.
One hour post treatment, measure the fluorescence intensity on a micro-plate reader at 492-495/517-527 nm.
Determination of ROS generation.

Remove culture media from the sample, leaving a small amount to avoid drying cells.
  • For 96 well plate, remove culture media to a minimum of 20µl .
  • For 6 well plate, remove culture media to a minimum of 200µl.
  • For a 35mm petri dish, remove culture media to a minimum of 200µl.
  • For a 60mm petri dish, remove culture media to a minimum of 500µl.
  • For a 100mm petri dish, remove culture media to a minimum of 1.2ml.
Store the sealed samples in a humidified incubator under 5% (v/v) C02 at 37°C in for 24-48 hours post-treatment storage time.
Determination of ROS generation.
One hour post treatment, measure the fluorescence intensity on a micro-plate reader at 492-495/517-527 nm.
Determination of ROS generation.
One hour post treatment, measure the fluorescence intensity on a micro-plate reader at 492-495/517-527 nm.
The set-up of the DBD-CAP device should resemble the following set-up.

source.body: Ensure the electrodes and sample are level and flush to avoid unstable plasma that will arc.

source.description: Note the relative humidity and temperature of the atmospheric air.
Note the relative humidity and temperature of the atmospheric air.
Note the relative humidity and temperature of the atmospheric air.

Immediately after CAP treatment, remove any remaining media in the plate and replenish with fresh culture media.
  • For 96 well plates, replenish with 100µl fresh culture media.
  • For 6 well plates, replenish with 2ml fresh culture media.
  • For 35mm petri dish, replenish with 2ml fresh culture media.
  • For 60mm petri dish , replenish with 5ml fresh culture media.
  • For 100m petri dish, replenish with 12ml fresh culture media.
Remove the sample from the DBD-CAP set-up.

source.body: It is vital for user safety to ensure this is carried out in the laminar air flow hood, as escaping reactive oxygen species are a health hazard.

source.description: Determination of cell viability.
48 hours post treatment, wash cells once with sterile phosphate buffered saline.
Incubate cells for 3 hours at 37°C with 10% alamar blue and 90% culture media solution without fetal bovine serum.
Using a multi-plate reader, measure fluorescence using an excitation wavelength of 520nm and an emission wavelength of 595nm.
Determination of cell viability.
48 hours post treatment, wash cells once with sterile phosphate buffered saline.
Incubate cells for 3 hours at 37°C with 10% alamar blue and 90% culture media solution without fetal bovine serum.
Using a multi-plate reader, measure fluorescence using an excitation wavelength of 520nm and an emission wavelength of 595nm.

description:
Plasma, the fourth state of matter, is an ionized gas that can directly interact with cells and tissues. A non-thermal plasma with weak collisions between electrons and heavy particles that is applied under atmospheric conditions is known as cold atmospheric plasma (CAP) (Conway et al., 2019). CAP generates short and long-lived reactive oxygen species (ROS), reactive nitrogen species (RNS), neutral particles, molecules, electrons an electromagnetic field, weak ultraviolet radiation and weak heating affect (Yan et al., 2018) that has lead to its' application in wound healing, sterilization and cancer treatment (von Woedtke et al., 2020). Di-electric barrier discharge devices are one of the most common CAP devices that generate short but wide plasma between an anode and a cathode using atmospheric air, and can be used to intensively treat a large sample area (Yan et al., 2016).
The purpose of this protocol is to outline the steps involved in setting-up a di-electric barrier discharge cold atmospheric plasma (DBD-CAP) device for the generation of reactive oxygen species on cell cultures. This protocol provides procedures for direct treatment with and without post treatment storage and also indirect treatment using DBD-CAP on cell cultures.
